issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: Runtime
components.description: Generic bucket for uncategorized runtime issues

fields.description:
Titanium proxies should support the on(), off(), and trigger() Backbone eventing functions. These functions should wire seamlessly into the eventing functions built in to Titanium proxies, meaning:

* on === addEventListener
* off === removeEventListener
* trigger === fireEvent
fields.summary: Titanium proxies built from markup should support all Backbone eventing

comments.body: In this ticket, a bug was also resolved that was firing event listeners set with *on()* multiple times. The wiring between Backbone eventing and Titanium proxy eventing has been fixed and on(), off(), and trigger() behave as expected when used by proxies.
